title: 111_hr6277
content: The Act titled "Combating Anti-Semitism Act of 2010" is cited in Section 1. Section 4 of the Global Anti-Semitism Review Act of 2004 is amended to include reports and briefs. The Secretary of State is required to submit reports to Congress on acts of anti-Semitism globally, including physical violence, harassment, vandalism of Jewish institutions, and incitement against Jewish people and the State of Israel. The Secretary of State must report to Congress on global acts of anti-Semitism, including violence, harassment, and incitement against Jewish people and Israel. This includes descriptions of emerging issues, government responses, actions taken to combat anti-Semitism, and monitoring and reporting on such acts. The Ambassador at Large for Monitoring and Combating Anti-Semitism must brief Congress annually on US policies to combat anti-Semitism globally, including advocacy within intergovernmental organizations. This includes promoting anti-bias and tolerance education, specifically targeting anti-Semitism and Holocaust education. The United States engages in various efforts to combat anti-Semitism globally, including providing assistance, training, and cooperation within intergovernmental organizations, advocating for policies in bilateral relations, supporting initiatives to monitor and combat anti-Semitism, and reaching out to Jewish communities worldwide. The United States advocates for monitoring and combating anti-Semitism globally, including encouraging countries to implement commitments, incorporating anti-Semitism efforts into public diplomacy programs, and providing training on the issue to various State Department personnel. The Office of International Religious Freedom staff, along with officers and staff from other departments and agencies as necessary. SEC. 3. OFFICE TO MONITOR AND COMBAT ANTI-SEMITISM. Section 59 of the State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956 is amended to change the title of "Special Envoy" to "Ambassador at Large" and require the President to appoint the Ambassador at Large with the advice and consent of the Senate. The State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956 is amended to change the title of "Special Envoy" to "Ambassador at Large" and provide funding for staff to assist the Ambassador at Large in carrying out their duties. SEC. 4. TRAINING FOR FOREIGN SERVICE OFFICERS. Section 708(a) of the Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended to include the Ambassador at Large for Monitoring and Combating Anti-Semitism, change the effective date to January 1, 2012, and expand the roles of various officers and staff within the Department of State and other Federal departments and agencies as needed. The Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended to include the Ambassador at Large for Monitoring and Combating Anti-Semitism, with expanded roles for officers and staff in relevant departments and agencies. This includes instruction on anti-Semitism and legal issues related to combating it.
